name: market for floor heating from air-water heat pump | heat, air-water heat pump 10kW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/14006/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset represents the service of floor heating in an average one family house in Switzerland. As heating system, a brine water heat pump is chosen with 2000 operating hours, a Seasonal Performance Factor of 2.8 and a heat capacity of 10 kW. The low temperature floor heating system has 40°C of inlet temperature and 30-35°C of return temperature. Life time for the heat pump and the floor heating system is assumed to be 20 years.;This dataset represents the service of floor heating in an average one family house in Switzerland. As heating system, a brine water heat pump is chosen with a Seasonal Performance Factor of 2.8 and a heat capacity of 10 kW. The low temperature floor heating system has 40°C of inlet temperature and 30-35°C of return temperature. Life time for the heat pump and the floor heating system is assumed to be 20 years. 

Floor heating process starting from hydronic radiant floor heating system.

This activity ends with heat at the floor heating system. This dataset includes heat losses during operation. This dataset doesn't include electricity requirements for the circulation pump.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/353:Steam and air conditioning supply/3530:Steam and air conditioning supply

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Operation in Switzerland (i.e. Swiss electricity mix)

exchanges.description:
Estimation. In Jakob et al. (2002) 6 % of heat losses during distribution are estimated. Former literature sources estimate 2 - 3 % heat losses (Jung 1987), regarding low temperature heating systems 5 % of heat losses were estimated. (Maier 1986)

 In this dataset heat losses during distribution are assumed to be 5 %. Electricity requirements for the circulation pump are not considered in this dataset. However, electricity requirements for the heat pump are considered in the heat pump dataset.

Heat extracted from ambient air is released again to ambient air, thus heat is not taken into account in this dataset.

Further references:

Jung J., "Zukünftige Heizungssysteme; Nutzungsketten - Verluste - Emissionen", Energiewirtschaftliche Tagesfragen 37.Jg (1987) Heft 2, s.166-171.

Maier , "Umweltvergleich von elektrischen mit anderen Heizsystemen Teil II: Bewertung ausgewählter Systeme zur Hausheizung unter dem Aspekt der Schadstoffabgabe, Fichtner-Studie im Auftrag der FTA, Stuttgart 1986.
EcoSpold01Location=CH

exchanges.description:
Estimation. A floor heating system with plastic tubing and aluminum heat conduction fins is chosen to ensure good thermal transfer. Life time of the floor heating system at low temperature is assumed to be 20 years.
